article.description:
Anthony Tolliver and Nick Porter scored 14
points apiece to lead Creighton (No. 25 ESPN/USA Today, No. 20 AP).
article.headline: Tolliver, Porter help No. 25 Creighton defeat MVSU
article.linkText: Creighton posts its 10th straight win in a season opener
article.story: OMAHA, Neb. (AP) -- Creighton's 78-42 victory over Mississippi Valley State on Monday night was all about defense. The 20th-ranked Bluejays' full-court press flummoxed outmanned Mississippi Valley into 23 turnovers that were converted into 24 points. Thing is, there were plenty of easy shots that didn't fall as the Bluejays shot just 39 percent (26-for-66). "We played so much harder on the defensive end that it kind of took us out of a rhythm offensively," Creighton coach Dana Altman said. "We got a lot of easy baskets in the first half where we got the ball to the rim and just didn't finish. We've got a lot of things to work on on the offensive end." Anthony Tolliver and Nick Porter scored 14 points apiece for Creighton, which posted its 10th straight win in a season opener. The Bluejays have won each of their last seven openers by at least 20 points. Fueled by their full-court pressure, they used a 15-2 run to create early separation and led 30-16 at halftime. They outscored the Delta Devils 13-3 over the first five minutes of the second half and led by more than 30 over the last five minutes. "We're not a team that's prepared to come and play in this venue against a team that's that good and be pressed," Mississippi Valley coach James Green said. "We're not at their level." Nate Funk, who had season-ending shoulder surgery after six games last year, finished with 13 points for Creighton and Isacc Miles added 10. Funk missed five of his first seven shots, but the Missouri Valley Conference preseason player of the year found his touch in the second half, going 3-of-4. Funk said he and his teammates can build on their opener. "The successful and consistent teams find a chemistry," Funk said. "It might not always come at the beginning. It might take some time. We don't have as good a chemistry as we'll have at the end of the year." Demarkus Barnes led the Delta Devils with 10 points. Mississippi Valley (0-2), which shot 25 percent in a 72-49 season-opening loss to Mississippi State, hit 31 percent against the Bluejays. Seven-footer Ronald Alexander made the Delta Devils' first shot of the game, then his team failed to score on 11 of its next 12 possessions. Creighton's press forced most of Mississippi Valley's 14 first-half turnovers. Tolliver's dunk off Nick Bahe's midcourt steal and pass finished the Bluejays' opening spurt against their opponent from the Southwestern Athletic Conference. The Bluejays never relented with their press. "I'm impressed that they could still be pressing with seven or minutes left in the game and still be just as aggressive -- diving after loose balls and all those things," Green said. "They had guys who had been playing. Usually guys that play that many minutes tend to let up. They don't let up." The Bluejays worked the inside against the Devils, who, except for Alexander, were at a distinct size disadvantage. Creighton attempted few shots outside the lane in the first half and didn't score from the perimeter until Funk's 3-pointer midway through the first half. Eleven Creighton players saw action, with all but one getting at least 10 minutes. Ten players scored. Creighton outrebounded the Devils 48-38, with Porter grabbing seven. "We've got a long way to go," Porter said. "I'm not satisfied with winning tonight. You've got to stay humble and keep hungry."

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
